bool GrPortal::IsCoplanar ( const MPlane &  plane,
float  epsilon 
) const

returns true if the portal is coplanar to the plane passed in.

public methods.

if all points lie within an acceptible distance of the plane, then the portal is coplanar.

too far from the plane? if so, return false.

success!

Definition at line 56 of file GrPolygonBSPPortal.cpp.

bool GrPortal::IsDegenerate (  )  const

returns true if the current portal is degenerate.

fan the polygon and calculate area for each triangle.

get edge vectors of the current triangle.

skip this triangle if one of the edges is 0 length as it obviously has no area.

calculate the area of the current triangle.

Definition at line 311 of file GrPolygonBSPPortal.cpp.

int GrPortal::Split ( GrPortal &  front,
GrPortal &  back,
const MPlane &  splitPlane,
const MPlane &  orgPlane,
float  epsilon 
) const

splits the portal by the plane passed in.

make sure the output portals are clear.

don't use an epsilon on the first one. We need an absolute side here.

if we're still on the plane, then ALL points are on the plane! Therefor, just consider it as on the front side and be done with it.

not all on the plane, therefor, we should check for any vertices on opposing sides of the plane.

determine the side of the current point.

should be impossible.

if the side of the plane has changed, and side is not 0, then -we need to generate a new vertex at the point of intersection with the plane.

if the current vertex's side was within an acceptible tolerance level, simply use it as the split. Since it will already be on the opposite side, we only need to add it to the new side.

add the new vertex to both front and back lists.

continue forward. Since we're using the current vertex as a split, we have no reason to add the vertex to it's current side.

we found a side change. We need to generate a new vertex and add it to both lists.

add the new vertex to both front and back lists.

set the side.

add the current vertex to the correct side.

this shouldn't be possible: we either have a full polygon or we don't. there should be no grey area here.

if we have 3 or more vertices on a side of the plane, then we need to create a new polygon.

return 1 for front, -1 for back, 0 for both.
